org.opendaylight.controller.containermanager.northbound

Class ContainerManagerNorthbound

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opendaylight.controller.containermanager.northbound.ContainerManagerNorthbound

  • public class ContainerManagerNorthbound
extends java.lang.Object
    Container Manager Northbound API

    Authentication scheme : HTTP Basic
    Authentication realm : opendaylight
    Transport : HTTP and HTTPS

    HTTPS Authentication is disabled by default. Administrator can enable it in tomcat-server.xml after adding a proper keystore / SSL certificate from a trusted authority.
    More info : http://tomcat.apache.org/tomcat-7.0-doc/ssl-howto.html#Configuration

      • viewAllContainers

        public ContainerConfigs viewAllContainers(java.lang.String queryString)
        Get all the containers configured in the system
        Returns:
        a List of all ContainerConfig 
        
 Example:

 Request URL:
 http://localhost:8080/controller/nb/v2/containermanager/containers

 Response body in XML:
 <containerConfig-list>
       <containerConfig>
          <container>black</container>
          <staticVlan>10</staticVlan>
          <nodeConnectors>OF|1@OF|00:00:00:00:00:00:00:01</nodeConnectors>
          <nodeConnectors>OF|23@OF|00:00:00:00:00:00:20:21</nodeConnectors>
          <flowSpecs>
           <name>tcp</name>
           <protocol>TCP</protocol>
          </flowSpecs>
        </containerConfig>
        <containerConfig>
          <container>red</container>
          <staticVlan>20</staticVlan>
          <nodeConnectors>OF|1@OF|00:00:00:00:00:00:00:01</nodeConnectors>
          <nodeConnectors>OF|23@OF|00:00:00:00:00:00:20:21</nodeConnectors>
          <flowSpecs>
           <name>udp</name>
           <protocol>UDP</protocol>
          </flowSpecs>
      </containerConfig>
 </containerConfig-list>

 Response body in JSON:
 { "containerConfig" : [
     { "container" : "black",
       "nodeConnectors" : [
          "OF|1@OF|00:00:00:00:00:00:00:01", "OF|23@OF|00:00:00:00:00:00:20:21"
       ],
       "staticVlan" : "10",
       "flowSpecs : [
          { "name": "udp",
            "protocol": "UDP" }
       ]
     },
     { "container" : "red",
       "nodeConnectors" : [
          "OF|1@OF|00:00:00:00:00:00:00:01",
          "OF|23@OF|00:00:00:00:00:00:20:21"
       ],
       "staticVlan" : "20",
       "flowSpecs": [
          { "name": "tcp",
            "protocol": "TCP"
          }
       ]
     }
   ]
 }

      • viewContainer

        public ContainerConfigs viewContainer(java.lang.String container)
        Get the container configuration for container name requested
        Parameters:
        container - name of the Container (eg. blue)
        Returns:
        a List of ContainerConfig 
        
 Example:

 Request URL:
 http://localhost:8080/controller/nb/v2/containermanager/container/blue

 Response body in XML:
 <containerConfig>
      <container>blue</container>
      <staticVlan>10</staticVlan>
      <nodeConnectors>OF|1@OF|00:00:00:00:00:00:00:01</nodeConnectors>
      <nodeConnectors>OF|23@OF|00:00:00:00:00:00:20:21</nodeConnectors>
 </containerConfig>

 Response body in JSON:
 {
    "containerConfig": [
       {
        "container": "yellow",
        "staticVlan": "10",
        "nodeConnectors": [
           "OF|1@OF|00:00:00:00:00:00:00:01",
           "OF|2@OF|00:00:00:00:00:00:00:02"
        ],
        "flowSpecs": []
       }
    ]
 }

      • createContainer

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response createContainer(@Context
                                        javax.ws.rs.core.UriInfo uriInfo,
                                        java.lang.String container,
                                        ContainerConfig containerConfig)
        Create a container
        Parameters:
        uriInfo -
        container - name of the Container (eg. yellow)
        containerConfig - details of the container as specified by: ContainerConfig
        Returns:
        Response as dictated by the HTTP Response Status code 
        
 Example:

 Request URL:
 http://localhost:8080/controller/nb/v2/containermanager/container/yellow

 Request body in XML:
 <containerConfig>
       <container>yellow</container>
       <staticVlan>10</staticVlan>
       <nodeConnectors></nodeConnectors>
 </containerConfig>

 Request body in JSON:
 {
    "container" : "yellow",
    "nodeConnectors" : [
       "OF|1@OF|00:00:00:00:00:00:00:01",
       "OF|23@OF|00:00:00:00:00:00:20:21"
    ],
    "staticVlan" : "10"
 }

      • removeContainer

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response removeContainer(java.lang.String container)
        Delete a container
        Parameters:
        container - name of the Container (eg. green)
        Returns:
        Response as dictated by the HTTP Response code 
        
 Example:

 Request URL:
 http://localhost:8080/controller/nb/v2/containermanager/container/green

      • viewContainerFlowSpec

        public ContainerFlowConfig viewContainerFlowSpec(java.lang.String container,
                                        java.lang.String flowspec)
        Get flowspec within a given container
        Parameters:
        container - name of the Container (eg. green)
        name - name of the flowspec (eg. ssh)
        Returns:
        flowspec detail as specified by: ContainerFlowConfig 
        
 Example:

 Request URL:
 http://localhost:8080/controller/nb/v2/containermanager/container/green/flowspec/ssh

 Response body in XML:
 <flow-spec-config>
      <name>ssh</name>
      <dlVlan>52</dlVlan>
      <nwSrc>10.0.0.101</nwSrc>
      <nwDst>10.0.0.102</nwDst>
      <protocol>IPv4</protocol>
      <tpSrc>80</tpSrc>
      <tpDst>100</tpDst>
 </flow-spec-config>

 Response body in JSON:
 {
    "protocol" : "IPv4",
    "dlVlan" : "52",
    "nwDst" : "10.0.0.102",
    "name" : "ssh",
    "nwSrc" : "10.0.0.101",
    "tpSrc" : "80",
    "tpDst" : "100"
 }

      • viewContainerFlowSpecs

        public FlowSpecConfigs viewContainerFlowSpecs(java.lang.String container,
                                     java.lang.String queryString)
        Get all the flowspec in a given container
        Parameters:
        container - name of the Container (eg. red)
        Returns:
        list of all flowspec configured for a container. Flowspec as specified by: ContainerFlowConfig 
        
 Example:

 Request URL:
 http://localhost:8080/controller/nb/v2/containermanager/container/red/flowspec

 Response body in XML:
 <flow-spec-configs>
       <flow-spec-config>
           <name>ssh</name>
           <dlVlan>52</dlVlan>
           <nwSrc>10.0.0.101</nwSrc>
           <nwDst>10.0.0.102</nwDst>
           <protocol>IPv4</protocol>
           <tpSrc>23</tpSrc>
           <tpDst>100</tpDst>
       </flow-spec-config>
       <flow-spec-config>
           <name>http2</name>
           <dlVlan>123</dlVlan>
           <nwSrc>10.0.0.201</nwSrc>
           <nwDst>10.0.0.202</nwDst>
           <protocol></protocol>
           <tpSrc>80</tpSrc>
           <tpDst>100</tpDst>
       </flow-spec-config>
 </flow-spec-configs>

 Response body in JSON:
 {
   "flow-spec-config": [
     {
       "name": "http",
       "dlVlan" : "52",
       "nwSrc": "10.0.0.201",
       "nwDst": "10.0.0.202",
       "protocol": "",
       "tpSrc": "80",
       "tpDst": "100"
     },
     {
       "name": "ssh",
       "dlVlan" : "123",
       "nwSrc": "10.0.0.101",
       "nwDst": "10.0.0.102",
       "protocol": "IPv4",
       "tpSrc": "23",
       "tpDst": "100"
     }
   ]
 }

      • createFlowSpec

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response createFlowSpec(@Context
                                       javax.ws.rs.core.UriInfo uriInfo,
                                       java.lang.String container,
                                       java.lang.String flowspec,
                                       ContainerFlowConfig containerFlowConfig)
        Add flowspec to a container
        Parameters:
        container - name of the container (eg. purple)
        name - name of the flowspec (eg. http)
        flowspec - configuration as specified by: ContainerFlowConfig
        Returns:
        Response as dictated by the HTTP Response code 
        
 Example:

 Request URL:
 http://localhost:8080/controller/nb/v2/containermanager/container/purple/flowspec/http

 Request body in XML:
   <flow-spec-config>
         <name>http</name>
         <dlVlan>25</dlVlan>
         <nwSrc>10.0.0.101</nwSrc>
         <nwDst>10.0.0.102</nwDst>
         <protocol></protocol>
         <tpSrc>80</tpSrc>
         <tpDst>100</tpDst>
   </flow-spec-config>

 Request body in JSON:
 {
    "name" : "http",
    "dlVlan" : "25",
    "nwSrc" : "10.0.0.101",
    "nwDst" : "10.0.0.102",
    "protocol" : "",
    "tpSrc" : "80",
    "tpDst" : "100"
 }

      • removeFlowSpec

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response removeFlowSpec(java.lang.String container,
                                       java.lang.String flowspec)
        Remove flowspec from a container
        Parameters:
        name - name of the flowspec (eg. telnet)
        container - name of the Container (eg. black)
        Returns:
        Response as dictated by the HTTP Response code 
        
 Example:

 Request URL:
 http://localhost:8080/controller/nb/v2/containermanager/container/black/flowspec/telnet

      • addNodeConnectors

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response addNodeConnectors(java.lang.String container,
                                          StringList list)
        Add node connectors to a container
        Parameters:
        container - name of the container (eg. green)
        list - The list of strings each representing a node connector in the form "|@|", as "OF|1@OF|00:00:00:ab:00:00:00:01"
        Returns:
        response as dictated by the HTTP Status code 
        
 Example:

 Request URL:
 http://localhost:8080/controller/nb/v2/containermanager/container/green/nodeconnector

 Request body in XML:
 <nodeConnectors>
     <nodeConnectors>OF|1@OF|00:00:00:00:00:00:00:01</nodeConnectors>
     <nodeConnectors>OF|2@OF|00:00:00:00:00:00:00:01</nodeConnectors>
     <nodeConnectors>OF|3@OF|00:00:00:00:00:00:00:22</nodeConnectors>
     <nodeConnectors>OF|4@OF|00:00:00:00:00:00:00:22</nodeConnectors>
 </nodeConnectors>

 Request body in JSON:
 {
    "nodeConnectors" : [
       "OF|1@OF|00:00:00:00:00:00:00:01",
       "OF|2@OF|00:00:00:00:00:00:00:01",
       "OF|3@OF|00:00:00:00:00:00:00:22",
       "OF|4@OF|00:00:00:00:00:00:00:22"
    ]
 }

      • removeNodeConnectors

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response removeNodeConnectors(java.lang.String container,
                                             StringList portList)
        Remove node connectors from a container
        Parameters:
        container - name of the container (eg. red)
        list - The list of strings each representing a node connector in the form "|@|", as "OF|1@OF|00:00:00:ab:00:00:00:01"
        Returns:
        response as dictated by the HTTP Status code 
        
 Example:

 Request URL:
 http://localhost:8080/controller/nb/v2/containermanager/container/red/nodeconnector

 Request body in XML:
 <nodeConnectors>
     <nodeConnectors>OF|1@OF|00:00:00:00:00:00:00:01</nodeConnectors>
     <nodeConnectors>OF|2@OF|00:00:00:00:00:00:00:01</nodeConnectors>
     <nodeConnectors>OF|3@OF|00:00:00:00:00:00:00:22</nodeConnectors>
     <nodeConnectors>OF|4@OF|00:00:00:00:00:00:00:22</nodeConnectors>
 </nodeConnectors>

 Request body in JSON:
 {
    "nodeConnectors" : [
       "OF|1@OF|00:00:00:00:00:00:00:01",
       "OF|2@OF|00:00:00:00:00:00:00:01",
       "OF|3@OF|00:00:00:00:00:00:00:22",
       "OF|4@OF|00:00:00:00:00:00:00:22"
       ]
 }
